page.title: 01Introduction
page.content:
Peterborough is one of the few places in Britain which has been occupied by man throughout human history.
In 1985, as this section is written, the city is just coming to the end of a period of expansion which has changed it from a quiet city on the edge of the Fens into a thriving New Town with a youthful population enjoying beautiful surroundings.
The heart of the city has been transformed from a declining market town into a paved, traffic-free shopping area with a distinctly continental flavour and with the modern Queensgate shopping precinct at its centre. Yet at its heart stands the timeless Norman Cathedral watching over the changing fortunes of man's brief lives.
